location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

mods.abstract: The letter mentions that Shaikh ‘Abd al-Rasūl Khān, the Governor of Bushire, is active in his preparations for the defence of Bushire and that Mohumed Nebbee Khan [Muḥammad Nabī Khān] has moved his Haram out of the town.One enclosure; letter from Captain Charles Pasley, Acting Envoy Extraordinary to Persia to Lieutenant William Bruce. The letter regards official dispatches for the Government at Calcutta.
